page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content: The oldest remaining house is a farmhouse called Bishopton Old Inn which used to be a coaching inn on the route from Glasgow to Greenock. Most of the other houses fall into 4 age groups. Those built between 1900 and 1940 were for private owners. In the 1950's private houses were built by Keanie, the local authorities and the Royal Ordnance Factory. Wimpey built large private estates in the 1960's and 1970's. Few houses have been built since 1976 as most of the land for housing has been used. 1 km west of Bishopton stand 3 houses known as"the 3 Bears" because 1 is big,1 is medium-sized and 1 is small.
